title: Boston city councilor’s plan to hike taxes on luxury apartment buildings sparks developer backlash
author: Cameron Sperance
bullets: Real Estate News Councilor Brian Worrell released a plan that calls for raising the tax rate on large and/or luxury apartment buildings and lower tax bills for the “average” Boston homeowner and small landlord.
The St.
Regis Residences, right, are luxury housing in the Seaport.

title: Report of shots fired prompts shelter-in-place at college near Boston
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News No injuries were reported.
Frank O'Brien / The Boston Globe, File ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Curry College in Milton was put under a shelter-in-place after shots were fired on Saturday.

title: Another Boston office building gets green light for housing conversion
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Real Estate The city has approved 19 office-to-apartment projects so far as officials push to bring more residents — and life — back downtown.
Boston has granted building permits to another office-to-housing conversion, this time in the South End.
Developers are converting a former office building at 615 Albany St.

title: A guide to Boston’s most historic graveyards and the legends behind them
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Things to Do Explore the final resting places of Massachusetts legends, from Paul Revere to Louisa May Alcott.
Granary Burying Ground in Boston.

title: Everett 7th grader held by ICE in Virginia denied bond, will stay detained during immigration proceedings
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News The boy reportedly apologized and asked the court to forgive him during last week’s bond hearing.
Demonstrators protested during a rally outside Everett City Hall prior to a city council meeting after a 13-year-old boy was arrested by Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents.

Barry Chin/Boston Globe Staff By Abby Patkin October 27, 2025 | 12:59 PM 2 minutes to read A 13-year-old Everett boy detained by Immigration and Customs Enforcement earlier this month following a brush with local police must remain in federal custody while his case is pending, a judge has reportedly ruled.

title: South Shore officer takes to the sea in a kayak to rescue golden retriever from drowning
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News The dog sustained no injuries in the incident Sunday.
A couple walk their dogs on Peggotty Beach in Scituate, MA on November 16, 2021.

title: Auchincloss calls for Platner to drop out of Maine Senate race
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Politics Rep.
Jake Auchincloss also said that Maine's state auditor should drop his primary bid against the moderate Democrat who represents much of rural Maine.
Rep.

title: Missing Middlebury College student confirmed dead after dayslong search, Vermont police say
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News “She was a gift to us and we are so grateful that she was — and will always remain — a member of our Middlebury family.

” By Abby Patkin October 27, 2025 | 11:37 AM 2 minutes to read Missing Middlebury College student Lia Smith has been confirmed dead after police discovered a body while searching for her on the school’s Vermont campus last week.
An autopsy Friday confirmed the woman’s identity as Smith, who had been reported missing several days earlier, Vermont State Police said in a news release.

title: Rob Gronkowski FaceTimed Tom Brady while interviewing Drake Maye
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update "Keep it up my man.
" Tom Brady and Rob Gronkowski after winning Super Bowl XLIX in 2015.

AP Photo/Kathy Willens, File By Hayden Bird October 27, 2025 | 11:08 AM 3 minutes to read Rob Gronkowski brought Drake Maye and Tom Brady together: With the Patriots once again thriving — now 6-2 under the burgeoning leadership of Drake Maye — New England fans could be forgiven for comparing the success to the Tom Brady era.

title: Duck hunter finds human remains near Merrimack River in N.H.
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News State and local police are investigating.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
New Hampshire State Police are investigating after a duck hunter found decomposed human remains in Merrimack, New Hampshire, on Sunday morning.
